reviews.text: Dreams is a stunning resort, with beautiful landscaping, accommodating staff, lovely rooms and generally good food. My husband, our 2 adult children and I enjoyed everything about the resort. The beach is also spectacular, and yes it does have rocky areas in the water but if you walked a little to the left of the resort you could play/swim in the ocean safely. The free form pool is amazing and you can access it from each building quite easily. There was some minor construction going on while we were there but it never bothered us in any way. The new owners are going to great pains in making this resort wonderful with added landscaping, walkways and coverings over the walkways. The food at the World Cafe (buffet style) was incredible with the hundreds of choices it offered. The "French" and Seaside Grill restaurants were excellent. The only warning I have is that the food at Himatsu and El Patio were very salty and it all tasted the same. Overall this was an awesome vacation spot and we would recommend it to everyone!!
reviews.title: Excellent tropical trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked Dreams back when it was still Sunscape and were a little worried as to what to expect with all of the changes that would be taking place. Once we arrived, all of our worries disappeared. Check-in went smooth, waited about 45 minutes at the bar and then went to our room. We stayed in room 6212 which is a club building right by the pool bar. We didn't have club privelidges, but for the 40 or 50 bucks a night it just wasn't worth it. We had the honeymoon suite and it was great, although we spent very little time awake in our room. There are plenty of restaurants to eat at. Our favorite was the Japanese restaurant. The rest were Ok and the Buffet always had something enjoyable for us.The pool, service at the bars, service at the restaurants, and the extremely friendy staff are what sets this resort way above the rest. These people work so hard all day and everyday, always with a smile. My spanish vocabulary is very slim and I never ran into a situation that was unmanageable. I would also like to give a special Thank You to Julio from the entertainment team. I don't know how he does it but be brightens the days of so so many people every single day. By the time we left we felt like we were leaving life long friends. And it wasn't just us, it was a lot people at the resort. It was very touching watching this 8 or 9 year old little girl hugging him good bye with tears in her eyes before we got on the bus to the airport. There Entertainment team really makes everyone feel special and are halarious as well. I can't comment on the actual shows that are put on in the theatre every evening because we always seemed to be busy doing something else. As far as the ride to and from the airport, the ride went smooth both ways and it's a reality check on how well we have it here in the US. If you really want to see the city I would definitely reccomend the ATV tour. It's about a 2 hour ride starting on the beach at dreams and along the shoreline then through some small neighborhoods and a pretty funny little store. We will definitely go back again.
reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful resort !

likes.liked: — Julio and the reat of his Team

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were pleasently surprised and just a little dissapointed at the same time. The package we purchased included an oceanside view from our room, but to our surprise, that view was completely blocked by palm trees and other tropical growth.
reviews.title: Not The Best But Still Enjoyable

likes.disliked: — Most of the staff could not understand English, but I am taking lessons to learn spanish!

reviews.title: Loved Dreams
reviews.text: The room was nice, the bed was a little too firm for me but still offered a good night sleep; well after all the drinks and activities sleep was not a problem. The room was a nice size which included a livingroom type area for watching TV.
My wife and I enjoyed the Jacuzzi on our belcony all night.
reviews.title: Fabulous Dreams!!!

likes.liked: — Wonderful resorts, food and entertainment team

reviews.text: Just returned from Dreams PR (Aug 10-17) with wife and 4 kids all under 8 years of age. Read reviews before going and was a little anxious as it seemed to be mixed. Quickly stated, Dreams is a great family all inclusive. I would definitely suggest it.
reviews.title: Just returned...Great trip!

reviews.text: We stayed in "Preferred" which gives you some additional amenities. For us this was good for access to Oceana Restaurant which was great for lunch and dinner. Outside of that we really didn't use the other services offered. The other good restaurants to mention were El Patio and Seaside Grill (next to Oceana)...very good food and great service. Portofino is the adults only restaurant...again good service but food was just blah...I'd skip it. The Japanese rest. had good reviews but to us it was just ok as well...not bad but just OK. World Cafe is the large buffet open all day....food was very good with a lot of selection and no waits or large crowds. For all inclusive I don't expect the food to be at the level of a top NYC restaurant but was mildly suprised that it was better then I expected in most places.
reviews.title: So glad we went.

reviews.text: Best thing for us was the Explorers Club...with 4 kids we wanted some time away and were worried that the kids would not have fun. Previously in Mexico we had issues in a similar resort club where the kids club employees spoke little English. Not the case here at all. ...there were so many activities for all diff types of personalities and all loved it. Carmen and Jennifer were just awesome...they give you a cell phone if the kids need you.....we never got a call. :)
reviews.title: Exelente!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pool is very large and goes from front of hotel (where they have large blow up slides and and iceberg for kids to play on) down to mid level of resort where pool is more secluded and quiet and finally to beach area where the large swim up bar is alive with constant activities. Pool is only 3 ft deep around which again with small kids is great. Dreams entertainment team kept the party going at the pool which was great for all ages. Bartenders Randy and the group were very attentive.
reviews.title: Exqusite and Awesome

reviews.text: We had a family suite which is really two adjoining rooms with 1 King and 2 double beds. Rooms were similar to what you see in other Caribbean resorts...we were on first floor which I found better as it would be pain in the neck to get 4 little kids up and down the stairs. With all to do we rarely stayed in our rooms. As a big business traveler I'm used to putting my clothes away in a dresser upon arrival..interestingly there were none here. That said there was ample room in the closets which also had shelves for clothes etc.
reviews.title: 4th Visit to Dreams Punta Cana - Different but still great
Dreams Punta Cana Not So Great
reviews.text: Just returned from 5 night stay at the Dreams Resort. My husband and I traveled there with a group of 18 people, all close friends and family. None of us were impressed. Last year we visited the Dreams Resort in Puerto Vallarta, Mexico and loved it.....wish we had chosen to go there instead this year. My husband and I didn't have any room issues with the exception of the air conditioning in our room not working the last day/night of our stay. That was the case for most of our group. Others had to move rooms a couple of times to get acceptable accommodations when they checked in. The food was not great, although we did like the Oceana restaurant for the seafood. The drinks were good, and in some of the bars you could get domestic beer. Service was slow for food and drinks. The pool was nice, and we enjoyed the swimup bar. The beach was clean. We were not impressed with the appearance of the resort, the grounds were kept, but nothing compared to the very lush, green grounds at the Grand Palladium in the Dominican. Out of the 18 of us, there were 5 of us that lost a day due to diarrhea and stomach cramping/pain. We booked our trip through Hotwire, and it was a good value, but we would rather pay a little more and not have all the travel time. We left DFW at 6:00 am and arrived at the hotel about 3:00 pm, and the return was even longer since we had to go through customs and immigration.

reviews.title: Great place...OK food!!
reviews.text: Wife and I and one other couple just got back from 4 days in Punta Cana at Dreams. We are in our late 20's and we had a great time. I figured I'd write this now since I just landed 4 hours ago. Trip started great as we left Pittsburgh 20 minutes early (USA 3000) as everyone was on board early. If you book through Apple or are just flying USA3000 be aware of this. Get there early and you get to PC a little earlier also. As for the resort....Dreams is what you make of it! If you want to have fun, you will. If you want to be picky about everything and are looking for 5-star dining this is not for you.

reviews.title: best vacation ever
reviews.text: The drive there from the airport is a little bumpy, but it's not that bad. It is around 1 hour and we were so excited we never even noticed.

reviews.title: Beautiful Landscaping, Poor Food
reviews.text: Check in at the resort is painless...you are treated with a glass of champagne and right from the beginning you see why people rave about the service here. The people are EXTREMELY FRIENDLY!! Our room was not done so we went and ate lunch and headed for the pool.

reviews.title: Dreams Punta Cana - PARADISE FOUND
reviews.text: First thing you notice is the amount of activity at the pool. It is the highlight of the resort. I have never seen a better pool in my life. Absolutely huge and gorgeous. We headed down to the swim up bar and immediately began indulging in some fine adult beverages.

reviews.title: Good - but not " Excellente' "
reviews.text: We went to the Dreams Resort for a 5 night stay, looking for a relaxing all-inclusive resort. Our travel agent was complimentary of the location, and the website and reviews were favorable. Just prior to our departure, USA Today rated it as one of the top 10 all -inclusive resorts in the Caribbean. That solidified what we thought would be an impeccable trip.

Upon arrival, you're greeted with a grand lobby and staircase - a great first impression... Would've been an amazing touch of class to be offered a beverage instead of a cold wash cloth, but that's just me. I noticed that depending on the tour and group pulling in, there was a different welcome provided (ie the Apple Tour bus was greeted with champagne drinks). Walking through the lobby, you have the opportunity to take in the resort. However, the best view of the 'grand mall' area is blocked by palm trees. A sure miss by the resort for those that want to take in the whole sight of the resort.
reviews.title: Great Entertainment!!!!

reviews.text: I believe this location could be so much more if they paid attention to details. As with all-inclusives, buffets are prominent. When they say there are 7 restaurants, they all are not open all the time. 3 are in one location (a Grill, seafood, and italian) yet in 3 different areas. There's a Japenese/Chinese restaurant, a Mexican style, and finally the main cafeteria/buffet restaurant. After eating on my first night, I became violently sick which immediately put me on guard for the rest of the trip regarding what I ate.
reviews.title: Beautiful outside, not so much inside

reviews.text: We chose to do a romantic dinner on the beach. After being seated, it took 20 minutes for the server to return to the table. Upon return, he informed us that 1/3 of the menu that was sold to me was not available, and being substiuted for other items - which in calculating, were lower cost (i.e. a ham style app for an iceberg salad).
reviews.title: Excellent family holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were decent, but the website can be misleading. When it refers to swim-up rooms, the water is not near your back sitting area. It's a good 10-20' away - so verbiage was misleading on the site. Despite using the a/c, the room was extremely humid. Yes, I realize I'm in the tropic - however it was dry during the day. At night, the room should have cooled down - but it in fact appeared more humid. Some cotton items never dried out the entire trip - even after using the blow drier to make it dry, it became wet overnight.
reviews.title: Best Place Ever !!!!!

reviews.text: I have just returned from here and I can honestly say this place has the worst food I have had at any restaurant, hotel or any public place anywhere in the world - terrible is not a strong enough word
reviews.title: Looks nice but don't believe what you see

reviews.text: In an all inclusive resort you need to have have choice - there are several restaurants so on paper it looks good and you think you will have good range of food to eat but the truth is the food is foul in all of the restaurants.
reviews.title: Best Service Experience Yet

reviews.text: In particular the Himitsu restaurant is incredibly bad - if this restaurant was on any street it would close down within months due to the poor quality of the food. Deep fried filth.
reviews.title: Not anywhere near as good as I was told

reviews.text: As if this wasnt bad enough on at least 3 occasions I was served partly cooked, raw food - very dangerous. This happened in 3 different restaurants.
reviews.title: Best holiday of my life!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did complain to the manager of the resort and they did make an effort to call us to ask us where we wanted to dine each night but the problem is...it doesnt matter, the food is still poor - the only exception being the 'surf and turf' special menu - but who wants to eat that every night...not me!
reviews.title: Our dreams were disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I read these reviews, I am a little confused! I can't believe that some of the reviewers stayed at the same hotel we visted. This March was our 9th or 10th visit to the DR, and our third stay at this hotel. Every visit has been fantastic! The staff cannot do enough for you, and they are very proud of their English which they have worked to improve over the years. Many of them, suprisingly, given the number of people they see, remembered us from previous visits and the registration staff have even greeted us with "Welcome home!" The food is at least equal to, if not superior to most of the other hotels where we have stayed ( and there have been many) - there is something for everyone - the variety and quality is excellent! Is everything like what we have at home? No - but if I wanted everything to be like home, I would stay home. The one thing I do agree with is that there is hoarding of the pool floats, and there were parents who even allowed their children to take 3 or 4 floats so they could stand up on them, or jump onto them. We asked once if we could have one, and the parent told us to go find another one. But that couldn't ruin the great vacation! Our room was very quiet and clean. Every day, we came back from the beach to find our bed decorated with flowers or animals made from towels. These people work very hard, and a kind word goes a long way. Any noise that we heard was from some of the guests, not from the staff. I remember a stay at another hotel where the cleaning staff would yell to one another in the hallway at 7:00 am. I never once heard a cart rolling or heard the staff in the hallways here. As to the beach, we walked several hours each day, and the beach was beautiful! The staff work very hard to keep everything clean for the guests, and they are constantly going around cleaning up the drink glasses and bottles left around by some of the guests. As to the sea grasses that washed up on the shore - how could anyone blame the hotel for that? There was inclement weather and rough seas, so it washed up. I saw the staff out there most of two days with huge trashcans and rakes trying to stay on top of it and clean it up as it washed ashore. We were there over spring break and Easter - the staff really tried to make Easter special for the children with the parade/show and with the Easter Bunny arriving on the Beach by helicopter. By the way, we did not have children with us, but we thoroughly enjoyed watching the Explorer's Club Team interacting with the children. The children appeared to respect and enjoy the staff, and seemed to really be having a ball! The activities group worked endlessly to keep people engaged - do they ever rest? We travel a lot, and our vacation to Dreams, Punta Cana is the one we always look forward to; we come home relaxed, rejuventated, and anxious for our next trip there! We love it, and already have our next vacation planned. We have referred many people there, and every single one of them has come back to tell us how pleased they were with everything! Kudos to the managers and staff at Dreams!!
reviews.title: Multiple fabulous stays!

reviews.text: I must say my wife and I were very disappointed with this resort. We have been to Punta Cana seven times and this resort was not what we expected. Upon arrival the lobby looks nice, but that is the extent of it. The rooms are absolutely tiny. There is not even enough room for two people to walk around in the room comfortably. The food and the service is subpar at best. The beach looks nice in the pictures, but let me assure you that it is not nice at all. It is very dirty and you need to go to the left near the frog trampoline to be able to go into the water. We transfered to the Majestic Colonial with the other four couples that we traveled with. I must say that all ten of us came to the same conclusion regarding Dreams. TNT Vacations was very accomadating and moved us from Dreams to the Majestic Colonial within an hours time and the Majestic welcomed us with open arms. Thank You TNT Vacations for your quick response to rectify a bad situation.I cannot recommend Dreams to anyone.
reviews.title: Not what we expected
Fabulous
reviews.text: Our first time at "Dreams". From the moment we arrived our vacation started. Coctails were given to us as we checked in. We did upgrade to the Large Suite, we had a large bedroom, livingroom, hudge balcany with a hot tub overlooking the pool & ocean. Wonderful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was magnificant - always eager to please even to the extent of serving in your room.
reviews.title: I would not recommend this resort to my friends
What a shock!!
reviews.text: Getting into the restaurants was not a problem at all. When you treat people good, they inturn do the same.

reviews.title: Food will make you sick - 9 days and still suffering
reviews.text: We stayed at Dreams from 18 - 23 May. Upon our arrival the room we were given had a strong odor of mildew. As we were discussing the possiblity of requesting a move my husband noticed a large mass of mold in the vent. We did request to be moved. We were moved to a room that was much smaller but it did not have the mold growing in the vents or the strong odor of mildew so we didn't complain about the size.

reviews.title: Absolutely the best hotel I have ever stayed in!
reviews.text: The food was not good and made us sick. We arrvied at Dreams on Sunday evening. On Tuesday night we got sick to our stomachs. There was another couple with us and they also got sick. It has been 9 days and we are still suffering. I finally went to the doctor yesterday and was given antibiotics and placed on a special diet for several days. I was told that I had acquired some form of a bacteria while visiting DREAMS. It seemed that just about everyone we spoke to while we were there was also suffering from stomach ailments.

reviews.title: Nice pool, shame about the food
reviews.text: The grounds and the pool are well maintained and quite lovely.

reviews.title: Dreams...more like a nightmare!
reviews.text: We would not return to Dreams, Punta Cana.

reviews.title: Dreams
reviews.text: I stayed at this resort for a week in May, with my boyfriend.

reviews.title: Beautiful Grounds - Rooms are Iffy
reviews.text: I had many of the same experiences are recent reviewers during my stay at Sunscapes/Dreams (2/8/08 -2/13/08).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I also had not known (along with our Travel Agent) that Sunscapes was now owned by Dreams. We discovered this when our taxi driver said, "No, no, no, you are going to Dreams. Sunscape no more." Nice.
reviews.title: Nice anniversary trip to Dreams

likes.liked: — Beautiful pool, nice staff, spotlessly clean, nighttime entertainment
likes.disliked: — Far from airport, not enough chairs by the pool

reviews.text: Upon check-in, we are greeted with a fruity beverage (yay!) and we work with the check-in agent to secure our room. Our particular agent spoke English but I felt as if many times he did not understand what I was asking, and therefore, you couldn't tell if it was simply a language barrier or if he was being shifty.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: He tells us that we are in a garden view room and asked if it was our honeymoon (no). For $60 more a night, he can move us to an ocean room (no, we're fine). He then says that he will put us in the ocean room anyway with a king bed (why? To be nice?) and announces that tips would be fine. Yes, yes, I should have known better... but I figured that if this is a room that goes for $60 extra dollars/night, $15 is the least I can do.
reviews.title: dreams what else?

likes.liked: — landscape situation of the hotel kindness of the staff
likes.disliked: — no choice on the beach snack only hamburgers hot dogs !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well, we get all the way down to the beach (Building 1)... the nearest building to the lobby is Building 5, so it was quite a walk. We walk in and it's two double beds and the furniture doesn't fit in the room - like, the tv hutch is crammed in the corner, partially obscuring the bathroom door, the walls are scratched up and the entire room just looks very... Comfort Inn and not like any of the rooms we've stayed at on other resorts/cruises. I admit, I am a hotel snob... but this just seemed awfully average or adequate.
reviews.title: Had a great time!!

reviews.text: Just returned from a wonderful week at Dreams in Punta Cana. We usually prefer adventure travel but the rest and relaxation of an all-inclusive was needed and Dreams met all our expectations.
reviews.title: Wonderful escape from Toronto winter!

likes.liked: — Great beach location, beautiful grounds and facilities, very friendly, ehtusiastic staff

reviews.text: We had no difficulties from check-in to check-out despite the resort being full to capacity. We arrived late, check-in was a breeze and our room was waiting for us. We were in building closer to the beach, which was a bit of walk to the main building but that was fine. The room was comfortable, clean and nicely, if a bit blandly decorated. We needed a room with two beds (they were doubles which was a bit small for a couple) and the room was also a bit cramped for three people. We were on the third floor, which wasn't a problem and we had a nice balcony with a lovely view of the pool and the beautifully landscaped grounds. The only real criticism of the room was the single door between the adjoining room which allowed for annoying transfer of snoring sounds, talking, TV and the smell of cigarette smoke. A double door would have provided better insulation.
reviews.title: This is the one!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As mentioned the resort was beautifully landscaped with tropical plants, palm trees, flamingos and fish in ponds and parrots in the trees. All the buildings and walkways were immaculate and were constantly cleaned and maintained. There was some work being done on up-grading the terrace near the Sugar Reef bar near a the beach but it was quite unobtrusive. The pool, which runs the length of the resort down to the beach was wonderful for swimming and the design prevented congestion and crowding. Lots of foam mats were available for floating down the pool under the Dominican sun. The beach was good, with lots of cots in the sun and shade, bar service and a great barbeque. Still had to deal with the annoying resort practice of having to wake up before 8am to claim a preferred spot under a thatched umbrella (which we weren't always successful in securing) but there was also plenty of other shade on the beach and we never had a problem finding a comfortable spot. The ocean was pretty calm due to a close off-shore reef despite constant strong winds There was a problem with rocks in the water at the main beach but it was perfect in the bay just to the left of the water trampoline.The water was not crystal clear at the edge but there was no difficulty walking in past the sandy surf and it was great for swimming, floating or bobbing in the gentle waves. Also had some great long walks down the beach to the left of the resort.
reviews.title: The Good, The Bad.... But No Ugly Here

likes.liked: — suites were good, clean, beach weather, good service
likes.disliked: — regular rooms small, uncomfortable beach chairs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the staff were exceptionally friendly and warm. Everyone made a point of greeting you with "hola" as you walked by. The wait staff in the restaurants were very attentive and tried hard to please, despite limited English. The "entertainment team" was fantastic and they worked hard, using their enthusiasm and Dominican charm to make the stay fun. We enjoyed the shows, the dance lessons and it was fun to practice our newly-learned merengue steps in the disco with these talented guys. 50-cent made a special effort to connect with my teenage daughter and that was great fun for her. All the staff work very hard, for long hours and for low pay. Tipping is not expected but much appreciated and we wish we had been better prepared with lots of $1 and $5 US bills, as it was hard to get change from the front desk.
reviews.title: Loved Dreams!!!

reviews.text: We went on one trip off the resort, the 'Outback Safari" which gave us a view of the Dominican countryside and a glimpse into life outside the gates. Learned a lot from our very intelligent and knowledgeable guide. It was a fun day, with great boogy boarding at the end of the day.
reviews.title: AMAZING!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were at the resort from Monday 10/24 through Friday 10/28. We have our own business and had not been away for 3 years. We were there only a short time and did not want to do anything but sit on a beach and go swimming. We booked Preferred and it was well worth it. Claudia, Adrian and Oscar in the Preferred Club were all so amazing; so professional, courteous and efficient. Nothing was a problem. Maykros oversaw the preferred beach area and he could never do enough for us. He definitely made our trip worth it! We looked forward to seeing him everyday with his great smile and wonderful attitude. He was genuinely interested in what we had to say about our experience and always wanted to know what he could do better (which was nothing - he was the best).
reviews.title: Preferred Club Worth It! Apple Representative RUDE!!!!

reviews.text: I cannot say the same for the Apple Representative at this resort whose name is Santos. I don't care to write negative reviews but frankly, there are plenty of folks who would love to have his job and would deserve it more than he. He was all smiles when we came for his orientation; but when we did not book any excursions as we only had a few days at the resort, he was downright ignorant. I have never in my life observed such rude and obnoxious behavior in an adult, let alone one in a service-oriented position. After we did not book any trips and went to ask him questions, he would ignore us and then when we kept asking him, he would not look at us and make eye contact. He was the rudest person I have ever met and if he was my employee he would no longer have his position. We have always booked vacations through Apple and have never experienced this with their employees. Please note this is NOT a reflection of any of the other Apple employees or the staff of Dreams - the resort employees were WONDERFUL, especially Maykros and Claudia.
reviews.title: Wow, Wow, N More Wows !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was dated, but the bed was comfy and the shower was hot. The dinner buffet wasn't that great but the sit down restaurants were fine. One thing that needs to be addressed is the dirty tablecloths at the buffet. When we were seated, our tablecloth had not been changed and had oil stains on it from the previous diners. It's just little things like this that will keep this from becoming a 5-6 apple in my opinion. The main grounds are lovely, the Dreams staff are wonderful and the Preferred Club is GREAT. Definitely worth what we paid. The only surprising and disappointing part of this trip was Santos from Apple.
reviews.title: Overated, Average, Not worthy of 4 or 5 stars

reviews.text: DRR, Drink, Refill, REPEAT, thats what its like here at Dreams Punta Cana, My trip here i met amzing friends that the memories will stick in my head forever. I wanna take a second n send a special thanks to Francisco, Melvin, Kelvin, Marlom, Francois, and my special dance partner Sunshine, that dance will be in my mind forever. I look forward to my return trip to Punta Cana, ASAP, my time spent with the entertainment crew and people on the resort was spectacular. 5star service, a true dream come true. Thanks Dreams !
reviews.title: Excellet

reviews.text: Spent 10 days there. In the middle of nowhere, $90 roundtrip to go off resort, insane. Was very clean but rooms were either moldy or good. After complaining about room was upgraded to a very nice one. The entertainment was good and those folks worked very hard. Front desk, housekeepers were very helpful and Omega was the best. Food from restaurants was below average and buffet was not very good. Myself and two other traveling with us got sick as well as other people I heard talking at pool. Unacceptable for a resort of this type. Beach is beautiful and so is pool area. Room service is terrible. Was in Cabarete( Northern Dominican) at a lesser rated hotel( Whyndam Tangerine) and it was superior. Would not go back here. Expected better, Average at best.
reviews.title: Amazing !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I travelled with Thomsons to Dreams Punta Cana arriving for a 14 night holiday from 4th October 2011.
reviews.title: OK, but did not live up to expectations because of hassles

reviews.text: We chose Dreams Punta Cana because of a brilliant stay at Dreams La Romana, in Nov 2010, and also because of a recommendation from a colleague of mine who stayed at this hotel 18 months ago and said what a brilliant experience he had. However it must be said that I do not feel that the hotel lived up to our expectations or the Thomson 4+ star rating it was given.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.text: The hotel is going through a refurbishment at the moment, but all the Thomsons guests arriving the same time as ourselves were placed in one of the accommodation blocks that are yet to be re-furbished. The result being that the room we were allocated did not have all the equipment it should have had as described in the brochure. Also the Thomson Website and the Dreams Website show the Deluxe rooms that we had booked with flat screen TV’s and better standard of décor than we all had. I had read in trip advisor that there was a higher standard of room available and I had emailed and confirmed an upgrade of the room before we left for our holiday direct with the hotel and had agreed a rate for the upgraded room, however on arrival Reception told us that they did not have a room because they were 100% full. This was a disappointment and the room they gave us did not have a hair dryer, DVD player or towels and bathroom sundries. A call to reception solved all but the hairdryer which was an issue had we stayed in the room.
reviews.title: What an amazing place.

reviews.text: The biggest “surprise” we had though when walking through the grounds to our room, was that the top half of the swimming pool (reception end) had been completely drained with hazard tape around the whole area. Neither the Thomson Rep or the hotel had let us know about a problem with the pool which was very annoying as had we known before we left we would have changed hotel before leaving the UK. We could not get any sense from anyone as to what was going on and how long the pool was going to be empty for , with differing stories from different reception staff varying from 1 day to a week before the pool would be filled. We contacted the Thomson helpline in the UK because we wanted to move hotel because of the pool and the room standard and they advised that they had contacted the hotel and that there was a problem with a leak in the pool which the hotel would have resolved in a couple of days. We were not happy and were advised to see the Thomson Rep in the welcome meeting in the morning and to contact the helpline in the UK if we were not satisfied with the outcome.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel! Defective AC!

reviews.text: After the rep spoke to the hotel, she arranged for us to have a free upgrade to another room which was a Junior Suite complete with a Jacuzzi on the balcony for which we were very grateful. The annoying thing was that we lost a day of our holiday while this was sorted out, when obviously we could have an upgraded room on arrival for which we were happy to have paid for.
reviews.title: not rated properly

I did get worried but i can confirm that these bad reviews were not true facts. I will go into each section of my review seperate to give a clearer review.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great vacation at Dreams last week! A truly fantastic hotel. The only down side is that it takes 1 hour to get to it, but trust me, it's all worth it. Who cares if it takes an hour, you're going to be in paradise when you get there!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are 6 restaurants, each with great staff offering great food. We loved Himitsu the best. Make sure you visit the grill on the beach, we went there everyday for fresh hamburgers, if you're lucky he'll have chicken and pork chops too. There's also the fruit lady on the side of the pool, she cuts fresh fruit daily for you!
reviews.title: Entertainment team--Excellent

reviews.text: The entertainment staff was amazing. They are funny and really know how to work the crowd. They work very long hours and are very committed. Go 50 cent! Make sure you participate in the activities each day, a great way to meet people and it's so much fun, and you get money for it! The shows at night were great, packed with lots of dancing.
reviews.title: Great expereience from sun up to sun down

reviews.text: The casino is a bit small, but I don't think the hotel needs a bigger one. I never had a hard time finding a seat, but the dealers are very grumpy and some are brand new, so make sure to watch your cards and make sure you're paid out correctly. All the staff at the resort had smiles on their faces, except for the casino dealers!
reviews.title: EXcellent Resort

likes.liked: — I liked having a room over looking the pool on the main level....
likes.disliked: — I could never decide what restaurant to go to.....

reviews.text: The beach was fantastic, stick to the left side, there are less rocks and it's also a bit quieter. All the beach activities happen on the right side. We had no problems finding chairs on the beach, and we usually got out there around 11am. The chairs around the pool seemed to get filled fast every morning, but when we headed over there around 3pm, we'd find some empty ones.
reviews.title: Loved Dream, GoTravel - not so much

reviews.text: Dreams is the place to be. This was my 5th time and in 3 weeks I'll take 60 repeat guests again. This place has alot for everyone. The children program is excellent. They have added Wii , X-Box, batting cage and the soon to be completed rock climbing wall. The Preferred Club now offers a private area on the beach with big beds, free internet and a more personal guest service. The sit down service at the Oceana for lunch now offers an assorted variety of sandwiches, which is a nice change. Most of the dinner menus have been upgraded, with different choices. The drinks also have been upgraded. A few added bottles of different liquor's. Bud, Bud Light, Miller Genuine Draft and Heineken bottles also were added. The employee's are still as friendly as ever and are waiting for you to return. Dreams is a great place that everyone should try at least once. To those who have complained or like complaining, please remember where you are. They try to address any and all problems that might come up. Not everything where you live is prefect either.
reviews.title: The Place to be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I went here for our honeymoon. We are all inclusive "newbees" having only stayed at one other one previously (Iberostar Del Mar in Cancun - good). We knew going in that all inclusives are not meccas for gourmet food and at Dreams we got what we expected. Food was OK - VERY SALTY.
reviews.title: Just OK - and you better like children

One of the reasons we chose this place was b/c of the policy - a little more sophistication... At every restaurant we ate we were surrounded by men in "wife beaters" and jean shorts, swim trunks, bermudas, etc. Very unappealing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a "honeymoon suite" in the building closest to the beach. Our room was acceptable but the ceiling in the bathroom was made out of slatted plastic? - i presume to have easy access to the roof (we were on the third floor). We were there during Tropical Storm Fay and during the day on Friday the ceiling did drip a bit in the bathroom but stopped by that evening. We are pretty tolerant people so we didn't ask to switch rooms (which we had to do earlier in the week at the hotel we stayed in in Santo Domingo - review to be posted shortly).
reviews.title: Great time at dreams
Great Time At The Dreams Punta Cana Dominican Republic
reviews.text: We just returned from 10 days at the Dreams Punta Cana. We stayed in building # 1. We had a very nice suite with a magnificent view of the ocean and over looking the pool. The service was great. Winston our room service person was great. Whenever we needed something he was right there. Margarita our maid did a great job cleaning our room and making swans out of our towels. Juan our concierge called every morning to make sure everything was Satifactory. There were 7 restaurantsand the food was very good.

reviews.title: Excellent Entertainment
reviews.text: Pool was very nice and the attandants were very friendly and right there with your next drink.

reviews.text: This is our second time back and we were happy to see familiar faces. Carlos solution was amazing and very accommodating! Yudith is the best at the world cafe and Rodriguez, Sergio, Negrillin( at the himitsu), Jesus, Adrian at the preferred club and so many more made every moment for us unforgettable! Thank you very much Dreams PC Staff!!!! Even though things changed since our last visit you still made it great!

reviews.text: Welcome home, its a pleasure, excelente! From the moment you arrive you truly feel at home! I was at this resort for about 3 weeks and I am still sad to be back home! Cant wait to return. The best part was the entretainment staff, all of them were amazing! particularly the Core Zone, I was there at night to play pool and other activities Jesus has planned there. He was the absolute best! During the day I did all the games at the middle pool and had loads of fun! Again he was responsible for all that so thanks Jesus for a great holiday. Some times the towel center by the pool runs out of towels and you wait for a bit but JEsus made the wait worth it! The night shows were also very good Moises, Ne-Yo, Yanely, STephanie thanks for being so nice! I had great fun!
reviews.title: Entretainment Simply BRILLIANT!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The preferred club was really good, ELvira and ALexis are great!
reviews.title: Vacation Get Away

reviews.text: The pool is huge and really nice, the beach is breath taking! Rooms are spacious, but would have liked a bigger space to put my clothes! Can't go wrong with a holiday at this place!
reviews.title: Great Pool, People, Food, Ok Beach and Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just got back from our vacation get away at Dreams Punta Cana. We were there from August 9th thru the 13th, 2013. We normally take cruises for our vacation get away, but we decided to try something new with an "All Inclusive" resort. After reading reviews and talking to friends we decided to go to Dreams Punta Cana in the Dominican Republic. When we arrived at the airport we learned very quickly to say No, Gracias! Everyone was trying to make a dollar to carry our bags. It took us an hour to get from the airport to the resort. Upon arriving at the resort we were welcomed and greeted with a drink and lunch.
reviews.title: Brilliant holiday in a very good resort

reviews.text: Hotel is beautiful. Great medium size all inclusive resort. Lots of food options and wonderful room service:) Staff was friendly and very helpful. I would say that the resort is great for both couples and families. The only improvement that I could recommend would be some updating to the rooms. Overall a comfortable and relaxing stay. Also be aware that this resort is not "in" Punta Cana it lies north about 45mins.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: Arrival Oct 21-28
reviews.title: Good trip BUT not a typical DREAMS

reviews.text: We came from Toronto with Sunwing to Punta Cana. We are a family of 3 people (2 adults, 8yr old boy). Seemed a lot of people – ourselves included - had issues at the airport with luggage weights – beware!! We were a group of 3 with an allowance of one 5kg carryon PER PERSON – we only had ONE carryon weighing 7.5kgs and they would NOT accept it – meant a lot of rearranging. We flew Priority and had a standard flight with no issues. We had a 3 hour wait to get in our room but were prepared with swimsuits accessible in suitcase (as it often does with early arrival).
reviews.title: Great Trip with Great friends!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOMS:
reviews.title: Dreams = Nightmare

reviews.text: We had a room on the ground floor in the preferred 7000 block with 2 beds. The room was fine - definitely nothing fancy. Had a large closet but no dresser, desk, flat screen tv, in room safe, coffee maker, stocked fridge (few beers and pop). We had a nice outdoor patio with table, chairs and hammock. We had no issues with hot water or a/c at all. Room was well cleaned every day and lots of towel animals, bath robes and slippers.
reviews.title: Dreams came true !!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've just returned from a weeks stay at the Dreams Resort and from the moment we arrived (6 hours later than expected) i couldn't have been happier with the holiday i picked. The staff were exceptional, the food was delicious with a wider variety than i expected. My girlfriend and I had breakfast every morning in the main buffet style restaurant and i don't think we ate the same thing twice. All well cooked meats,eggs along with an array of cheese, fruit, cereal and lots of others. Even the most picky of eaters wouldn't have gone hungry. Tea time's we'd try the a la' carte restaurants, of which there was 7 to choose from. The Italian and seaside grill were our favourites but all had great service and well cooked food. Neither I nor my partner were ill at any point in the holiday including eating our meats rare (the only proper way to enjoy meats). Being british we were the minority (wearing my football shirts every day soon made the english known to me) but wasn't really a down side americans seemed very friendly towards us. All bars were fully stocked and service quick and with a smile. The rendezvous bar was our favourite in the evenings where you could also watch the show from a high view point. Check in and check out were prompt with wine on arrival a nice touch. Overall like i say we both loved it and will hopefully be back next year.
reviews.title: Everything you could wish for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Best vacation of our life-food is all good chinese -japanese-mexican-steakhouse-buffet all great ...the view at the italian restaurant is awesome-its on the second floor-outside bar area is the best- inside faces the ocean....food very good...also the seafood restaurant(just dinner) is also ocean front with breakfast-lunch-dinner----great relaxing place to have breakfast/lunch and be relaxed the ocean/music everything instead of the large buffet----beaches are awesome -if you want shallow calm blue water head to the left-waves and privacy go to the right in between the two resorts-incredible location---pool is huge-bars everywhere-service constant---if you cannot find a chair because people claim them just find a Dreams Staff worker and they will get you one(not a problem tip if you like)---All top shelf drinks anything you what just ask-_Beer is Presidente at all bars -Boehmein in the room and you can get corona at the mexican rest.-and MGD at lobby bar.-----grounds are incredible everywhere --rooms very nice could be a bit cooler but not a problem-beds super comfy -pillows u can pick from 4 types---try to get a first floor poolside if possible they looked nice/convenient walk out an jump in---entertainment was good in theatre -lobby also had some entertainers--wish we could have brought our kids because this place has it all for kids a paradise for kids..i did feel bad...We booked with Apple vacations and got Dreams on a 5 square deal- we could not of been happier...Apple had a dinner on beach one night/the last night surprised us with steak/lobster dinner best ever..Santos who works with apple does a presentation the 2nd day very honest informative...we booked our only excursion with him -the Bavaro Blast 3 things u do snorkel/snuba/ride small james bond speed boats 2 person boats at that-incredible time only 75.00pp (10:40-3:30)so whole day not wasted...the sand in bavaro beach whiter/softer but location at Dreams better not congested....enjoy thanks apple------and Dreams for our memories
reviews.title: EXCELLENTE,TOP NOTCH ALL OVER,GREAT TIME

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot believe my travel agent recommended this place to us, two 28 year olds on their honeymoon. There were some positives...the beach was beautiful, weather obviously perfect, spa great, and overall, the grounds were kept up fair enough. But, the negatives outweighed any positives. The food was mediocre at best, and inedible at times ... to the point that my wife and I on more than one occassion took two bites of our food and pushed the plate away. For the most part, the food is mass produced, low quality fried food....not my idea of eating well on a vacation. They don't have enough chairs at the beach or by the pool, so all guests that want a lounge chair are forced to get up by about 8am to walk down to the pool/beach to put a towel or personal belonging on a chair in order to reserve it. Speaking of towels, be prepared to use the same one the entire time you are there because they are extremely difficult to come by...for some reason they are always out of towels. For an all inclusive, it's ironic that somebody on the resort is always trying to sell you something...whether a time share, excursion, overpriced cigar, trinket, or piece of island jewelry....they are pushy. The casino is a joke...it's the size of my bedroom at home and personally, I think there is some "funny business" that goes on there, so don't expect to win. The service is poor...drinks were brought to us at the pool or on the beach few and far between, and the staff (especially the front desk and concierge) are rude and don't care to treat you well. And, nobody at this resort seems to pay attention to details...little stupid, annoying stuff....like our toilet paper holders being broken in the room, the shower having a cracked, discolored ceiling, housekeeping "forgetting" to turn down our bed (and bring us towels) half the nights, the burger bars by the pool/beach being "out" of ketchup, mustard and other basic condiments three days in a row, the lack of booze poured into mixed drinks...those things are obviously not big deals in and of themselves, but add up to a frustrating experience overall. Some reviewers seemed to have enjoyed the "entertainment team," but I don't see how...they were annoying, and responsible for "Who Let the Dogs Out" and other cheesy songs from a 1998 Jock Jams CD being blasted from speakers around the pool area. Lastly, the guests at this place seemed to be mainly families and senior citizens, with a few slimy 50 something year old drunks taking advantage of the all inclusive bar. I'm sure there are some nice resorts at Punta Cana, but this surely is NOT one of them. Do yourself a favor and stay away from (Bad) Dreams Punta Cana.
reviews.title: Dreams? More like nightmares!

reviews.text: Amazing resort and terrific food for DR (remember where you are, adjust your expectations and think about what to order). Great service and wonderful staff!
reviews.title: Dreams do come true!

reviews.text: We have returned today from a week's break with our 7 year old daughter. We were rather nervous about what we were going to find after reading the reviews from others on here, but have to say that some people's moans and groans have got to be rather over the top - albeit it is their own experience which in some cases was totally the opposite to ours! Just want to give you some feedback on what we consider to be the main points of a holiday.
reviews.title: Fantastic time - some areas could be improved

reviews.text: Don't believe the nay-sayers about this fabulous resort. We just arrived back home today and are already planning to visit again. The rooms, pool, services, the extraordinary Explorers Club were far beyond our expectations!!! Although I will admit the ride from the airport was long and bumpy (it seems as if a highway is in the process of being built), it is well worth it. The Dreams staff were amazing. The Sugar Reef staff were great...it was our favorite place to "hang out" during the day. Everyone always had a ready smile and a friendly "Ola". The entertainment staff shone brightly....I loved the dance lessons and step aerobics near the beach. There were so many things to do all day every day. The nightly shows were so entertaining...make sure to see the magic show, we were truly amazed. The food was very good, we especially enjoyed the "mexican" restaurant and the World Cafe buffet. My children both cried when it was time to go home. We will definately be returning to Dreams....and hope to be able to stay longer next time.
reviews.title: Fabulous Vacation!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort is all about what you expect from it. My husband and I had never been to a resort before, and all we were expecting was the negative stuff we had read about on the forums. Some of it was true, but on most things we ended up being pleasantly surprised. I think one of the key things that helped make this an excellent trip was that we went on the forum and met another couple (first-timers as well) who was going to be there at the same time as us. They were so nice, we checked in with each other several times a day.
reviews.title: A wonderful trip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our comments...
reviews.title: Highly recommend this resort

likes.liked: — varitity of food, service was out standing
likes.disliked: — Large rock in the water were dangerous to swimmers, area should have been roped off to keep guests from injuring themselfs.

reviews.text: The room: We had a honeymoon suite. We asked to be moved into the Preferred Club, but they weren't able to accommodate this because the resort was full. We were glad, because the Preferred Club seems like kind of a waste of money. We preferred the location of our room (building 8) because we were close to the lobby and the calm part of the pool. Our minibar was refreshed at least once a day (sometimes more). There were ants in the room. Welcome to the tropics! The ants bothered us the first day, but we learned how to control them. First of all, they go where the food is (duh!). Don't eat in your bed. Keep any food sealed tightly and in the minifridge (if possible). When finished with room-service, seal all of the dishes up and leave them in the hallway. We never saw bugs in our room that were bigger than ants. Our room was beautiful with a stunning shower area. The bed was harder than my bed at home, but it was HUGE and we had no problem sleeping comfortably. We did not have a bathtub in our room, but we had a huge jaccuzzi tub on the balcony. The tub fit 2 people comfortably, but it would have fit more people. We were lucky that ours was mostly private... for other people it was easy to see them in the tub.
reviews.title: This was an amazing place, I've traveled to Punta Cana - 10 times

likes.liked: — Service, Staff and Excellant food choices
likes.disliked: — There were no elevators.. so limited access to top floors and the Bordeaux restaurant, which was a premier restaurant.
