Wow Wow Wow Dreams is a Dream Come True
reviews.text: Wow Wow Wow is all i can say about this Place.

reviews.title: Perfect Stay at Dreams!!
reviews.text: Stayed 28th April with my partner both early 20's. We booked through Thomson and as soon as we did came on here to read up on all of the reviews and forums and instantly became worried due to a vast amount of negative and bad reviews. We were even considering changing hotels due to my constant worries. I am 100% glad that we didnt as i had a holiday of a lifetime.

reviews.title: Mixed reviiews....some good and some bad
reviews.text: When arriving at the airport and stepping off of the plane you immediatly know that you are in paradise, for those who havent been before the airport is a joy all in itself compared to the one you have just left, it just looks wonderfull, but i wont spoil it for you and give too much detail.

reviews.title: amazing resort!!!!!
reviews.text: The transfer to Dreams was a bumpy one as most people have said, but the driver did his upmost best to avoid all of the bumps and holes in the road, and it really is the other drivers that seem to cause the disrupt. This journey took about 45 minutes and shows you the real side of the Dominican that you become oblivious to once you arrive at Dreams.

reviews.title: The BEST VACATION EVER!!!
reviews.text: On arrival we were greated with cold towels and we had checked in within 10 to 15 minutes. And were told to go straight to our room and our bags would follow. Walking to the room was breathtaking, the grounds of this hotel are immaculate, i hadnt even been there an hour and i was glad i hadnt switched hotels.

We went there and we had other hotels to compare the Dreams punta cana and wow did it excel every expectation!!!! This hotel was beautiful and the food was delicious!! Go to the mexican resturant!!! the beach was amazing and if you get a chance go to the private club where you get access to the private beach which has amazing beach beds!! the service at the private club was outstanding.. Yann and Vanessa who manage the private club are unbelievably helpful and courteous!! they both speak great in english and you will have no problem with them! I still haven't even mentioned the great fun atmosphere by the pool!!! Great music and entertainment!! at night you can enjoy the wonderful entertainment from the huge stage and theator!! I hope you go and enjoy yourself as much as me!!
reviews.title: Amazing Wonderful Best Service!

reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay at Dreams Punta Cana! We traveled as a big group and our first day was rough ... lost luggage and some mix-ups with our accommodations.
reviews.title: Great Stay at Dreams Punta Cana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Remember, you are on Dominican time...a Dominican minute is 30 minutes, so sit back and relax, don't sweat the small stuff. The staff was friendly and the entertainment was outstanding. By the time you leave, you will be humming the Club Mix!
reviews.title: Pretty Good Bang for the Buck.

likes.disliked: — Pool gets a little crowded and rowdy by the pool side swim-up bar (Manatee Bar) and volley ball nets

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was better than other all-inclusive resorts, a few members of our party experienced "stomach issues", but nothing serious. The pizza was awesome and the spanish omellette on the breakfast buffet - these are a must! The beer was cold, but the mixed drinks were a bit water-downed, so you need to ask for rum, etc...the Sammy Sosa and Banana Mama were favorites. Even though the resort was all-inclusive, we found that tipping and getting to know your servers goes a long way.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel loved it

reviews.text: The resort is rather large, so map it out. The beach and ocean are spectacular. We found it to be breezy at the beach with plenty of sun and shady areas.
reviews.title: WOW What An Amazing Vacation !

likes.liked: — My Room Was Hugh & Had A Jacuzzi On The Balcony

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I, like many, poured over the reviews before me and was pretty scared. I had purchased an Apple Vacations 6 Apple Square Deal (August 11-15) and then they revealed to me the name of the hotel, I was a bit disappointed. But it was already done so I packed my Imodium and bug spray and hoped for the best. I have to say, I really enjoyed myself. This is our 7th trip to the DR and our 4th to the Punta Cana area. The check-in was easy and the front desk was very pleasant. However, as we were checking in, there was a woman speaking to management (who was being extremely kind and tried to assist) about a problem she was having with her room. Whether she had a valid complaint or not (after hearing what it was, she did not), she was so rude and disrespectful to the staff it was embarassing. I just thought to myself "these are the types of people that write horrible reviews and say everything was terrible - they can't be pleased either way!" Our check-in was super easy and we had a swim-up room in building 5, which is closest to the lobby. My preference was to be closer to the beach but I really didn't mind. The room was a bit datedbut clean and comfortable. Not a fan of the swim-up rooms - a little too much activity for me. Everytime I went out of my room on the patio, there were tons of people at the pool across from the room. Not relaxing but since I am a beach girl, it didn't matter. And speaking of the beach, it was lovely. Never had a problem getting a chair, even when we arrived at 10/10:30. It never seemed crowded at all. However, though the beach is large, there is only a small section you can swim in. ne section is for snorkeling and one you can't get into at all because of the rocks. So for those who like to swim, the area to swim is small and that part of the water gets crowded. But no seaweed and very clean.
reviews.title: Lovely vacation with true Dominican hospitality!

reviews.text: We ate at the World Cafe buffet, Oceana (seafood) and Patio (Mexican) and I have to say that our favorite was the buffet. You could always find something yummy for any of the meals. The seafood restaurant was blah (it's hard to impress me with seafood - I'm from NE) and the Mexican was just ok. Thankfully, we did not have any issues with illness and we sanitized often during our meals.
reviews.title: Another excellent holiday

reviews.text: I liked the fact that you didn't have towel cards, no bracelets and no reservations needed. I felt less like cattle and more like a guest. However, what makes Dreams great is by far their staff. As mentioned, we have been to the DR many times and this place had some of the kindess, friendliest, hard-working staff I have ever seen. Genuine kindness. We would chat with our morning waiter (Francisco) every morning and we had lots of laughs and fun with the entertainment staff. Stephanie was lots of fun and Melanie at the World Cafe made us smile everyday we saw her. Just a great group of folks. Would I go back again? I would consider it. I'd pick a different room but it is definitely not even close to being a terrible place, as some of these reviews would have you believe. Definitely worth a visit!
reviews.title: EXCELLENT!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from Dreams Punta Cana and although this was our third time we were a bit reserved due to some negativity recently on trip advisor. Well we have had another amazing fantastic experience the staff especially Yudith and Lydia in the World Cafe were charming, courteous and welcoming each time my husband and I went in to eat, the food was lovely lots and lots of choice and very clean. Round the pool we especially liked the service provided by Larissa and Elizabeth and the bar staff Juan Paulo Edwin and David, The pool boys kept the pool spotless and there were always plenty of sun beds . Our room 9315 was spacious and kept very clean with fresh towels supplied every day for our comfort, In the Al La Carte our favourite was the Sea side Grill with our waiter Christian, and yes it did get very hot but we found if we asked for a table near the entrance it was cool enough for us with a lovely sea breeze. Hector our concierge was very helpful and answered any questions that I had before we went overall the experience was fantastic and we will be returning
reviews.title: EXCELLENT PLACE!!!

reviews.text: Don't understand why people bash this place. Its simple, don't change your diet and eat stuff here that you wouldn't eat back home. We had 85 guest here for our wedding and it turned out to be the best trip experience my wife and I ever encountered. I'm a native of the Domincan Republic and have been coming to Punta Cana since I was 8 years old (now 26). This place is excellent and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a nice relaxing getaway.
reviews.title: EXCELLENTE!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from Dreams Punta Cana. We were looking forward to staying at a higher end property on really nice beach. Unfortunately our room was small, had mold around tub, 4 poster bed was 1x4 wood railing with curtains, housekeeping service was haphazard, we had 2 towels and one handtowel and had to ask for more. The ceiling of the room (near the bathroom) collapsed under a flood of water.
reviews.title: Does not live up to it's billing
Best resort ever
reviews.text: Food was good with enough choices to be able to find something to please. Beach was very windy, rocky and not safe to swim in. No shopping close by and no other restaurants to visit.
We felt that it was sold to us as a high end property and it did not meet our expectations. I would not return and would not recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: A Week of Fun and Sun!

reviews.text: We just returned from Dreams. This is the fourth time we have been to Punta Cana and this was by far the best resort ever. The food was great. Entertainment by Veronica and JC at the pool was great. We met the nicest people from the US and Canada. The rooms are small but we were not in our rooms very long. Top shelf liquor and American beer was great. We like to try different resorts on vacation but I am sure we will return to Dreams some day. Excellent
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel. Will go back in a Heartbeat.

reviews.text: Stayed at Dreams Punta Cana from Feb 18th-25th, 2011. 650 rooms, good size. We have been to larger resorts and smaller. A La Carte restaurants were great, no waiting to be seated. (check what the dress codes are before going to the restaurants, men have to wear long pants at some, etc.) Service is at a good pace, you don't feel rushed, and the food was fabulous. Ate at the buffet for breakfasts and lunches - equally as good, and with class, i.e. linen napkins put on your lap by the hostess and plenty of staff to re-fill your glass and take-away plates, done quietly and efficiently. The beach grill and bbq by the pool the food was great also and good for a quick lunch. GREAT burgers! The bars were well staffed and only waited a very few/if any minutes to be served. The first part of our week the waves were huge! FUN for body surfing! We had a ground floor room in building 2. Ground floor rooms in bldg 1-5 have the pool feet from your patio - perfect! Rooms were cleaned very well every day. The shows were wonderful to watch each evening. 24 hour room service was a real plus! If there is anything you need just ask......don't complain after the fact. We had a great week and our only complaint is that we had to come home to the cold Canadian winter.
reviews.title: Good but not great-review for family with young Children

reviews.text: Lovely, lovely resort, pool, staff. We had a marvelous honeymoon suite (my husband & I of 20 years and our 14 year old) in #7 bldg. I guess a newer one of the buildings. No problem with room. Maids are awesome. Teen club was perfect for our teen to hang, play wii, pool, ping pong, dance, etc...To balance this however was the fact that we all got terribly sick starting 4-5 days into the trip. My daughter is a vegetarian and did fine - she even ate salads and drank the water in the restaurants, ate fruit and drank non-alcoholic drinks so our MD was thinking E.Coli infection. Never been sicker. Missed work for 3 days on our return and was put on anti-biotics. IF you go - please tip - these guys make a small salary and a dollar to them is huge.
reviews.title: Caution on the food

likes.disliked: — the after math of eating the food

reviews.text: By the way - this Dominican resort posts "No Topless" around the resort. Also, we couldn't really swim - the waves were ridiculously rough and random sharp rocks made for a dangerous combo but the pool more than makes up for it. Also, Gustav was passing overhead. Only rained 2 days for 20 min each day but was overcast pretty much 5 of the 7 days which was OK. (I'm light-skinned). My husband did the $100 deep sea fishing trip - didn't catch anything (they sell dramamine in the pharmacia in the hotel)- also had to laugh...they had viagra too.
reviews.title: Nightmares not Dreams

likes.liked: — Nothing, didn't get to see it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The boys in El Patio were a riot - silly bunch - like to laugh and joke. Japanese habachi not worth the trouble for us - good food but quite the hassel to get in.
reviews.title: a nice vacation
Don't Go
reviews.text: Well, as in our review title we decided to rename this hotel Nightmares not Dreams. After a long and very bumpy drive from the airport, we arrived at Dreams at around 6pm all excited to start our holiday. First impressions really good, lobby looked absolutely lovely and quite glamourous but very hot - but hey we were in the Caribbean what do you expect, hot climate is part of the reason for coming. Friendly hotel porters were quick to offload our luggage and label it ready for transporting to our rooms. Upon joining queue at check in desk we were greeted straight away by a friendly waitress with an ice cold glass of champagne or fruit juice if you preferred. This was a good start and made us feel very welcome, and this is where the good holiday feeling ended. Everybody seemed to be checking in ok and when we arrived for our turn (we were near the back of the queue) we had a sheet torn out of our ticket book and told to go and sit in the lobby area which we did and had a cold drink while we waited we assumed for the bellboys to take us to our rooms (we were a party of six adults, parents with two daughters and their partners). Well, we sat and waited and waited. After about half an hour we decided to make enquiries with reception how long we could expect to wait and were told that someone was going to come and talk to us. We thought this rather strange but went with the flow and sat it out for a bit longer. Another half hour passed, further enquiries and were told same thing again. Beginning to lose patience and finally after two hours sitting there with no explanation of delay decided to start stamping feet and demanding information. The senior receptionist finally came over and informed us that the hotel was overbooked and that there were no rooms for us (we booked this hotel 18 months previously, how could there be no rooms - they had known we were coming for long enough!!) When asked what was being done about it, the staff informed us that he would get back to us. Oh, no, this sounded familiar and yes, you guessed, we were still sitting there at 9.30pm hot, tired and with nowhere to go and the hotel staff just shrugging their shoulders. Well, tempers were flaring by now with the hotel staff just disappearing so we contacted our rep on the emergency number she had provided us with on the transfer coach (thank god, she had and not waited until the welcome meeeting). Fair play to our rep, she was there within 10 mins to help us and put her foot down with the hotel who had still done nothing to help us but ply us with free drinks which is all well and good but would rather have somewhere to stay. We were eventually at 10.30pm offered an alternative hotel which was a 20 min drive away (which actually turned out to be more like 45 mins). We were disappointed because we wanted to stay at Dreams having seen all the lovely pics on the internet and didn't know anything about the hotel we were being transferred to, but couldn't really complain as we had nowhere else to go. By now, we just wanted to get away from Dreams. They offered us to transfer for one week and go back to them for the second week which we weren't happy with (we didn't want to keep packing and unpacking, if we wanted a two resort holiday we would have booked one) but decided to accept just in case the alternative hotel wasn't very good but with the option of staying there if we preferred it. Preferred it, best thing we did - the other hotel was absolutely lovely and far superior. We also found out that another family had experienced the same problem and had taken the option to transfer back to Dreams after one week (they were transferred to the same hotel as us) which they did and regretted it. If you are planning on staying at Dreams, take a tip and check availability of your rooms nearer to your departure. It's a shame we never got to see the rest of the hotel and resort but with the attitude of the check in staff we have decided not to try Dreams again. Will go back to Dom Rep but not to Nightmares!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just returned from a one week vacation. We left Monday August 25th and returned Monday September 1st. We (my fiance and her sister) had nice weather other then a few passing thunder storms. The hotel is nice and the employees were all nice and very helpful. This was my first visit to D.R. and my first all inclusive vacation. We booked through apple vacations. I never really liked the idea of all inclusives, but decided I would try it. I guess it works for some, but I will never do it again.
reviews.title: 7 Nights and 8 Days in Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly, let me say that where you stay in the resort will have an impact on your opinion of it. If you are lucky enough to have a room away from the renovations then you have a better chance of a good holiday. The problem is the building works move around the resort, how will you know you have a good room until you arrive, then its too late!
reviews.title: Its a gamble - you may not get a good holiday

likes.disliked: — ongoing upgrade, poor food, tummy upset!

reviews.text: So at the moment I would say stay away from Dreams until the resort is brought up to date. Don't gamble with you hard earned money!
reviews.title: Clappy clappy!!
Multi Generational Family Vacation
reviews.text: Thomson and Dreams did not offer me accurate info regarding the upgrade, if they had I would have changed my booking. Be warned.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I too had a downgraded flight on the way back home, and no extras that were part of the package. Our rep was useless at the airport, she had no idea where to go or what to do. Thomsons you were rubbish!!!!
reviews.title: Easily worth the money

reviews.text: STAFF:Generally staff were brilliant.They are the best thing about this resort.
reviews.title: Best family vacation ever
Our trip to Dominican Republic
reviews.text: As our Traveling partners wrote a sterling review, I will only add that my wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Dreams Resort @ Punta Cana DR. The accomodations are excellent and the staff very professional and fun-loving. The food at the various restaurants was tasty and plentiful. Drinks, well, that's what this place was all about. Any drink, any amount, any time of the day/night. Bars had a nice selection of brands, I even had a Jack on the rocks that was every bit 5 ounces of liquor. Had to nurse that one.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I had one suggestions for them, I'd say they need to have more variety of shopping for suveniers etc. But that was ok, I saved some bucks. Also, I don't believe the folks in DR know anything about ADA, so if you have a disability be prepared to be 'flexible'. It 'ain't the USA baby".
reviews.title: Dreams Came True In Punta Cana

reviews.text: all in all, I'd rate our vacation a 9.9. Have to hold back just a tad with our connecting flight in Miami on our way back to Washington D.C.
reviews.title: Breathtaking from Seattle Washington

reviews.text: N&N
reviews.title: Perfect Family Vacation

reviews.text: Pooleville Md.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The purpose of our trip was strictly for leisure and relaxation.
reviews.title: Beautiful...with a few hiccups

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was beautiful and welcoming. The beach area is clean and comfortable with plenty of sun and shade. There are numerous waitresses waiting to take your order for drinks. The pool is massive and beautiful but definitely more crowded. Again, there are tons of waitresses wanting to take your order. There are bars all over the place so you are never far from another drink - if thats your cup of tea.
reviews.title: Fantastic - again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurants (7 of them) are okay at best. Nothing outstanding but they serve their purposes of delivering food.
reviews.title: Beautiful, but not 5 star

reviews.text: The entertainment team is excellent and work their butts off to make sure everyone is having a great time. I'm not sure where they get their energy from but they did an outstanding job from morning until night often working 14 or more hours a day. The shows were excellent and appropriate for the whole family. ERICK is the man.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOMS - Our room was fairly small but comfortable and mostly clean. The beds were amazing. HOWEVER, several of the rooms have an adjoining room separated by only a door. You can HEAR EVERYTHING coming from the neighbors room. This affected us only on one night when a family arrived. They were very loud late into the night arguing. Thankfully this was our last night. Our other neighbors seemed to acknowledge the sound issue and were quiet. The maid service was okay but we often needed to request items that weren't replaced....like soap.
reviews.title: STAY AWAY !!!!!!!

reviews.text: The resort was exceptionally clean and well taken care of. We had a slight problem upon arrival on Saturday late afternoon. It seems there was a problem assigning us a room. When we finally got in, it was very small, not enough storage for clothes, no shower door/curtain and a leak in the ceiling of the bathroom. We were finally moved to a new room on Sunday afternoon. From then on, our stay was really good.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort

likes.liked: — Cleanliness and beauty of grounds, pool and beach
likes.disliked: — Our first room was small, had no shower curtain/door and had a leak in the bathroom ceiling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the staff was very friendly, especially the entertainment team (i.e. Julio). We were treated as friends.
reviews.title: Preferred Club rooms not worth it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The entertainment provided each evening at the theater was great. The entertainment team is very talented and enthusiastic.
reviews.title: Not too Impressed.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some in our group thought the food portions were small. I, however, had all I could eat. And since it was all inclusive, you could always go and get more. There was never a lack of food or drink, and always someone to serve us.
reviews.title: Not My Dream

reviews.text: It was a beautiful resort and would recommend it to friends.
reviews.title: Still a lot of work to be done to be rated as a 5 star.
Great Holiday!!
reviews.text: Just got back from a 2 week stay at Dreams with my fiance and two friends. Overall the hotel was lovely, rooms were great, food was great with excellent variety, the grounds were beautiful and well maintained, service in all restaurants and the bars was good. Air conditioning in the room wasn't that great though! Waiters and all staff couldn't have been more friendly and welcoming.

reviews.title: No service with a smile
reviews.text: The entertainment team were fantastic and made sure that you were involved in all activities, usually we wouldn't get involved but this time we did, and it was good fun. Mickey and 50 in particular were hilarious and always made an effort, they were great fun. Evening entertainment was also good.

reviews.title: unforgetable vacation
reviews.text: Overall had a great 2 weeks and would return to this hotel.

reviews.title: Great R7R in the D.R.
reviews.text: Hayley Thompson, UK

reviews.title: The best holiday......ever!!
reviews.text: Just got back and what a disappointment. The food selection and quality was, at best, that of an average diner in the States. nothing was ever hot nor cold. The grounds were pretty but tired. The whole place was in need of an update and repair.

Just got back from two weeks of paradise at Dreams Punta Cana. We travelled with another family and not one of us could find one thing about this hotel that we could fault. The staff - from gardeners, housekeepers, waiters to the entertainment team are the friendliest people we have ever met. Be prepared to say "Hola" about 50 times a day. We took part in loads of activities (something we would not normally do) and had great fun - join in as you get to meet people and the entertainment team are great fun - they are not pushy just want everyone to have fun.
reviews.title: Fantastic holiday

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, good food, excellent pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Restaurants were great. World Cafe had something to suit everyone and the biggest breakfast selection I have ever seen - though our favourite was to go to Seaside Grill for breakfast and look out at the ocean.
reviews.title: Good Resort, Couple of things to Note
Dream come true!
reviews.text: Rooms were excellent - didn't find them too small as others have mentioned - requested connecting rooms which they couldn't provide until 5th day of our holiday so they upgraded us to two ocean view rooms - didn't bother to move as fell in love with waking up to the sea. Housekeeping were fantastic - my children would go out to chat to Rosa who would keep them supplied with chocolates!! The rooms were spotless and it was great to return every evening to turned down beds decorated with flowers, lamps on and soothing music - real luxury.

Pool was fabulous - hotel was full for first part of holiday and yet the pool never seemed busy - lots of quiet areas if you just wanted to float around. Children loved the iceberg in the pool and the turtle in the sea. Pool bar area was busier as that is where many of the activities take place. Beach was great - walked for miles - didn't feel unsafe at all.
reviews.title: Great holiday, just what we needed.

likes.disliked: — occasional noise from other guests in corridor

reviews.title: Awesome Place for the Family
reviews.text: Shows were good though they all repeated the second week so we knew what to expect.

My wife and I took our 6 year old son to Dreams from April 5-11 and we had a fantastic vacation. We have traveled the world and stayed in everything from the Ritz down to Hampton Inn's and Dreams is a great place to go. Anyone that wrote a bad review must have a negative attitude or never have left the U.S.
reviews.title: Awesome Family Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: * Drive from the airport:
reviews.title: We had a great time.

reviews.text: We booked our trip through Costco Travel which saved us several hundred dollars and included transfers to and from the airport in an airconditioned van. Although the roads did have pot holes, it was a straight drive and the roads were not hilly windy. It took right at an hour as expected so no surprises on that front.
reviews.title: dreams was a dream

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: * Kid Club:
reviews.title: Dreams.. almost dreamy!

likes.disliked: — All the walking, no elevators in buildings

reviews.text: Our 6 year old son LOVED the Kids Club. The staff was top notch and they listed the activities for each day so you could make sure your child was there for the things they really wanted to do. They give the parents a cell phone and call you when your child wants to leave. They had activities in the Kid Club area as well as on the beach. They would even take the kids to lunch and dinner if they wanted to go which allowed the parents a meal to themselves which was nice. Marylyn was in charge of the Kid Club during our staff and we couldn't of asked for more.
reviews.title: It Is What It Is. No time to look for all the negitive.

likes.disliked: — Sewage Smell in the pool table outside area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will start this entry by stating that we have stayed at the Dreams resort in Cabo San Lucas, Mexico and it was absolutely amazing! Don't let this review detour you from traveling there!
reviews.title: Not so much a "Dream"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now...to Dreams Punta Cana...: Upon arrival at the airport, we were highly impressed with how quickly and easily the entry into the country, baggage claim, and finding our bus was. The hour and a half ride to the resort was absolutely brutal! We were so nauseated by the time we arrived that we could hardly stand. The potholes are terrible, our driver swerved to avoid potholes making you very dizzy, and we had to stop at five resorts before arriving to ours. When we got out of the bus, we headed toward the check in counter where they finally came to give us a cold towel. We never did get champage--even after asking for it and waiting for approximately 10 minutes. Check in was relatively easy--no problems there. Our room was actually ready upon arrival, which I was glad to see that it was.
reviews.title: 4 stars out of 5 in my book

reviews.text: We made it to our room, the bag boy had our luggage waiting, and then came the disaster! Our refrigerator was not cold, there were drink and dirt stains on our couch and loveseat and rugs, the bathroom area was extremely dated, there were ants in our jacuzzi on our porch, the remote didn't work to our television......shall I continue?? It was not a good start to our vacation.
reviews.title: Best Holiday ever!!!

likes.disliked: — The Vendors can get a bit irritating...

reviews.text: We decided to go ahead and get showers and change and head to dinner. We were familiar with the restaurants because they are the same as the ones in Cabo. We loved SeaSide Grill and were thrilled to be going back. We walk down that way, and suprise surprise! It's CLOSED for the WEEK!!! This is the restaurant where you can actually get "American food".
reviews.title: Very Nice Getaway--Just what we needed!

likes.liked: — Pool, Entertainment Team, Chocolate Cake at the World Cafe-best ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did go to Oceana and the food was average. As far as the other restaurants go, World Cafe almost made me gag before the end of the week because we had to go there SO often! El Patio's chips and salsa were great--but my entree was disgusting! Don't order the chicken quesadillas!! Himitsu (we went to the Hibachi grill) was good--the cooks don't know any tricks--but we were pleased since the food tasted good. Our favorite restaurant at the resort was Beurdoux--we had an excellent server and the food was delicious. Too bad we discovered this restaurant on the last night. To receive a diet coke, it was a complete act of God! Service was SO slow....the only thing that is quick is wine, orange juice, and coffee....if you want anything else, be prepared to WAIT!!!
reviews.title: Fantastic return trip.

likes.liked: — The staff, the pool, the food, the spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have just returned from a 3 week holiday at Dreams Punta Cana. I don't usually do feedback on websites, but since I found previous feedback exceptionally useful, I thought I would payback the favour!! I also felt it necessary to address some of the less positive feedback....
reviews.title: 3 weeks of bliss!!!

reviews.text: This was our second time in the Dom Rep, we have stayed previously at another 4Star, as well as the Moon Palace in Mexico, so can make fair comparisons with other resorts. Additionally, I have worked in the travel industry for 10 years, visiting in my professional capacity a range of hotel chains across the world, so I feel I am speaking with knowledge and from experience.
reviews.title: Pure Paradise!!!

reviews.text: To begin with, the journey from the airport to the hotel:
reviews.title: An OK Experience

reviews.text: This is not really anything to do with the hotel, so it is not fair to judge the property on this factor. I always find the journey to my resort a fascinating one, and if, as with most Caribbean resorts, you are predominantly hotel based, this is a useful insight into the country you are visiting. The Dominican people live in basic accomodation in prefabricated housing, often growing fruits and vegetables, keeping a few animals. They are mainly self sufficient (think- The Good Life), and exchange produce with other villagers, and sell some from the roadside. They are always keen to give a wave and a smile:-) Yes the roads are bumpy, but this all adds to the experience!!
reviews.title: Great time @ Dreams-The staff makes it happen

reviews.text: Upon arrival at the hotel, we were greated with champagne (no flannels or juice), and the bellboys register your luggage with your room number once you have checked in.
reviews.title: Dreams In Punta Cana - Not Really Quite A Dream

likes.liked: — We had a suite which was quite large and very close to the beach. Most of the rooms were not.

reviews.text: Please don't believe all of the negative reviews about this place. My friend and I just got back from a long weekend and we absolutely loved it. Yes, the road from the airport to the hotel was very rough, but you are in a third world country.
reviews.title: Great vacation, great hotel!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, the hotel was well maintained, we constantly saw someone cleaning the floors or taking away empty glasses from the pool.
reviews.title: Honeymoon at Dreams

reviews.text: Our room was clean, not the newest furnishings, however again, everything was CLEAN. Our fridge did not work upon arrival. We asked the maid for a new one and by the end of the day we had it.
reviews.title: Dreams Punta Cana

reviews.text: Overall the food was good. Bordeaux was the best restaurant, and the World Cafe was good for breakfast and lunch.
reviews.title: Dreaming of returning to Dreams Punta Cana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Entertainment staff was great and so were the bartenders. Again, I was leery about this place after reading all of the negative reviews, but I was very impressed overall with this hotel and would definitely recommend.
reviews.title: Identity Theft Anyone?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a week at "Dreams" in Punta Cana..It is the most fantastic resort you can imagine !! An absolutely beautiful setting, gorgeous beach, fantasic restaurants and the cleanest place we have ever been to !!! The 300 yard long "floating" pool is wonderful !! The service people are immaculate and sooo polite and helpful !! Probably the best Entertainment Team in the Caribbean ....who wouldn't love "Mickey Mouse" and "50-Cent" !!!! We travelled with Apple Vacations and they were great !! The weather was magnificently boring !!...89 everyday !!! We couldn't have asked for a better escape from the deep snow of Vermont !!!
reviews.title: The Very Best ... Fantastic !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before I left for my trip I read dozens of reviews of Dreams written here. While most reviews were very positive I have come to the realization that some people are chronic complainers and are not happy unless they are miserable and complaining about something. Who cares if there is no internet in the rooms or you see a bug outside? You are on vacation relax and have a good time! That being said the resort was amazing and I have ZERO complaints.
reviews.title: An Amazing Place
Totally Amazing
reviews.text: The Resort: The grounds are beautiful. The pool is excellent. The beach is clean and wonderful. The bars have top shelf liquor and there are so many things to do, water sports, dance lessons, pool games, etc. The rooms are good but who really cares because you don't go on vacation to sit in you room right? Don't bother upgrading to the Honeymoon Suite for an extra $100 a night. It isn't really worth it unless you plan on not going to the beach or pool and sitting in your room all day. Hey I can sit in my room all day back in cold New York.

Food: The French place was excellent as was the Seafood and the Asian Restaurants. The Italian was pretty bad, I wouldn't suggest it. I didn't get a chance to go to the Seaside Grill or El Patio for dinner but I heard they were good. World Cafe (The buffet) was ok but keep in mind it is mass produced buffet food. Not great but not bad either. I wouldn't go there for dinner. Hit it up for lunch and breakfast but go to the Ala Carte restaurants for dinner.
reviews.title: 50 Cent is the Man!
fabulous vacation resort
reviews.text: Drinks: The bars all have top shelf liquor, good Dominican beer and fast service. You order a drink and the bartender will remember you and hook you up the second you come back. Our favorite bar was on the one right in the lobby. Get to know they bartenders, they are all cool guys/girls. We suggest you try the drink called the Dirty Monkey. It is so good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hola ~ Back from a week at Dreams and so sad we had to leave. For context, I have been to the Caribbean 25 times now; Dreams Punta Cana is the only resort which I have visited more than once. Matter of fact, this was my fourth time and the place keeps calling me back.
reviews.title: It is ALL about the people!!!

reviews.text: The grounds were immaculate. Whether it be night or day the view from anywhere on the resort was amazing. The pool ... well, the pool lol. The pool is one of the primary reasons I continue to frequent this resort. It is large and drawn out which allows people to get their party on at the pool bar, relax somewhere along the 'river' part of the pool or play with your kids at the more kid friendly end. Admittedly, we spent most of our time at the pool bar ; ) Had a blast every day and met the greatest people!! It is truly my philosophy that happy, easy going people attract happy, good people. We made 'lots' of friends there ... Special shout out to Dan and Gabby from Jersey!!!
reviews.title: Awesome for all ages!

reviews.text: The food was excellent most evenings but never worse than good. Please people, it is the Caribbean. If you want 5 star food, put on a suit, drop $200 in a restaurant where you live. Set your expectations accordingly, be happy and you will love this place.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort with the best Service

reviews.text: Speaking from experience, the rooms here are a little dated but perfectly fine. With the exception of sleeping we don't go to DR with the intention of spending anytime in our room. On this particular trip we were provided with a swim up room in building 1 ... I don't think we can go back from that ... simply awesome.
reviews.title: Great experience for a first timer!

reviews.text: Most importantly, the single greatest reason I continue to come back to this resort, the people. I cannot say enough about the staff at this resort. They work long, long days and always are welcoming and happy. It was actually disappointing to see how some visitors treated them; barking orders at staff or turning up their noses. These people and good, hard working people at that .. not your servants. And heaven forbid you bring up the topic of tipping!?!? We are generous with our tips b/c they deserve it. People would give an average service 15-20% at home but the pockets seal shut when it comes time to put a few dollars on the table after you have been served a wonderful dinner by a person who earns a fraction of what we do at the end of a 12 hour shift. We were actually rather shocked by the lack of consideration.
reviews.title: Above & beyond
